challenge.heading: THE CHALLENGE
challenge.text: Two founders launching a luxury wellness brand with no digital presence, undefined requirements, and a volatile vision.

myRole.heading: MY ROLE
myRole.text: Lead designer & Project manager. I acted as the bridge between non-technical stakeholders and the development team.

outcome.heading: THE OUTCOME
outcome.text: I established a strict design-to-development protocol to control scope creep, successfully launching a responsive booking platform that enabled the client to host their first international retreat.

section1.title: Managing the idea loop
section1.frictionText: The stakeholders were first-time founders with a constantly shifting vision. This resulted in "Scope Creep," where features were requested, built, and rejected in days, wasting valuable development time.
section1.pivotIntro: I realized the lack of process was hurting the product. I implemented a "design freeze" protocol:
section1.ruleText: No code is written until the Figma prototype is signed off.
section1.resultText: This stopped the "churn" in development. By forcing stakeholders to make decisions in the low-fidelity phase (Figma) rather than the high-fidelity phase (Code), I saved the project estimated weeks of refactoring time.

section2.title: UX strategy - advocacy vs. implementation
section2.conflictText: The client pushed for aggressive sales tactics (dark patterns like fake urgency counters).
section2.standText: I advocated for transparent, trust-based design, warning that high-pressure tactics often backfire with luxury demographics. While the client ultimately overruled some decisions (business constraints), I ensured the core booking flow remained functional and accessible.

section3.title: The process - iterative prototyping
section3.visualizingIntro: Since the clients struggled to articulate their needs verbally ("Make it pop," "Change this again"), I moved to rapid interactive prototyping.
section3.point1: Instead of static screens, I presented clickable flows.
section3.point2: This reduced misinterpretation and forced the clients to "feel" the bad decisions they requested before we committed them to code.

section4.title: The outcome
section4.outcomeText: Despite the volatility, we shipped a fully responsive web platform on time. The site successfully processed the intake for the inaugural retreat, allowing the founders to execute their proof-of-concept event in Bali.
